Package org.kj.config

Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kj.config.Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the values of game constants. Includes the target sum, starting hand size, minimum and maximum card value, number of each card in deck, and maximum deck size. The constants have default values but can also be set by reading in from a file. The constants can also be reset to their default values at any time.

    • Field Detail

      • TARGET_SUM

        public static int TARGET_SUM
        The target sum. If a player's hand equals this sum then they win the game (or tie if the other player also got the same sum). If the player gets over the target sum, then the player busts. Default value 21.

      • INITIAL_HAND_SIZE

        public static int INITIAL_HAND_SIZE
        The number of cards initially dealt to each player. Default value 2.

      • MIN_CARD_VALUE

        public static int MIN_CARD_VALUE
        The minimum value of a card in a deck. Default value 1 (represents an ace).

      • MAX_CARD_VALUE

        public static int MAX_CARD_VALUE
        The maximum value of a card in a deck. Default value 13 (represents a king).

      • NUM_EACH_CARD

        public static int NUM_EACH_CARD
        The number of each card value in a deck. Default value 4.

      • MAX_DECK_SIZE

        public static int MAX_DECK_SIZE
        The maximum number of cards that may be in a deck. In essence the number of cards a deck has before any are dealt out. Default value 52.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Settings

        public Settings​()

    • Method Detail

      • loadFromFile

        public static void loadFromFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Reads the specified file and reads in the values for the fields. The names of the fields must not be modified from their original name. For example, the property "target_sum" must always be written as such in the configurations file. The delimiters between the field and the value must be as described in Properties.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file to read properties from

      • restoreDefaults

        public static void restoreDefaults​()
        Restores the fields to their default values.
